Fields.DialogueText: We have Morganas headed in! Everyone to your stations!
Where’s Mahan?
Last I saw her, she was headed toward her quarters, Captain!
Mahan!
Sorry, Captain! I’m here!
It’s about time!
@BATTLE
So, tell me, Mahan - were you aware Morganas were headed directly for us?
I did sense them, but...
But?
Well, I was in the midst of reading a new book on naval strategy - it’s a real page-turner - and I might have gotten distracted by one particularly compelling passage...

Fields.MenuText: You understand that Morganas should come first... right?
You were distracted... by a book?
You and I are going to have difficulty seeing eye to eye, aren’t we?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yes, Captain, of course!
I assure you, Captain, this book is fascinating!
I... I don’t know if I’d go that far...
Just don’t let it happen again.
Yes, Captain.
Anything else, Mahan?
Could I borrow that newspaper you have on your desk there, Captain? I like to keep up on current events.
... Yes, here you go.
Thank you!
Mahan?
Augh! Captain, you scared me! You really shouldn’t sneak up on people like that!
I’ve been standing in the doorway for five minutes now. You really had no idea I was there, did you?
I... uh... must admit that, while studying, my situational awareness tends to... uh... plummet.

Fields.MenuText: You think working on that might be beneficial?
That’s not incredibly reassuring.
I’ll need to keep that in mind in the future...

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, yes. In fact, I’m much better than I used to be.
Ah, ha, ha... I know.
Why? And why are you smirking?
I suppose your dedication to studying is commendable, though. You keep yourself aware of the all the latest strategic tactics?
Of course, Captain! It’s my duty, I believe.
Captain! We have Morganas headed this direction.
You hear that, Mahan?
Yes, I heard that. I’m not a complete lost cause.
Well, then - let’s get to it.
@BATTLE
Really?
Unfortunately... yes.
Absolutely no reason.
I’m sure.
So, you understand why, in such a situation, it would be beneficial to cease fire for a time?
Anyone?
No?
You’re serious?
I agree. It would seem as if we were opening ourselves up to attack.
Only if you were to look at the situation with the most elementary of mindsets.

Fields.MenuText: My apologies. That was a little harsh.
I’m only being truthful, here.
You mean to tell me the two of you actually graduated from naval college?

Fields.DialogueText: That’s considerate of you to say, Captain.
... We know.
Well, that’s not very nice.
These strategies are just so contrary to what we were taught prior to the war.
Well, then, maybe you need a new teacher. In fact...
Captain, we have Morganas approaching from the north! I’ll go sound the alarm!
Hmmm...
@BATTLE
There you are, Mahan!
I don’t know that I’ve ever seen you smile quite that wide, Captain. Everything all right?
Yes, yes, everything’s fine. In fact, I think I might have an opportunity for you.
For me? Well, I do love a good opportunity, epecially if it involves learning. Does it involve learning?
It does.
It does?
Well, not on your part. I’d like you to take the officers aboard this ship under your wing and teach them a thing or two about naval strategy.
You want me to teach... the officers?

Fields.MenuText: Considering your love for strategy, I thought it would be a perfect fit.
Thus far, I’ve found them wanting, as far as the subject is concerned. They need a capable teacher.
You sound tentative. Why do you sound tentative?

Fields.DialogueText: You did, did you? Ha...
And you that I am... capable, do you?
I’m not tentative! Why would you think I’m tentative?
Mahan, what’s wrong?
Nothing, Captain! I will... do my best.
I’m happy to hear it. Befriend them, pass on all that you deem important - I trust your judgment on the subject.
*ALARM*
Right.
@BATTLE
Mahan! There you are. Have you gotten a chance to talk to the officers yet?
Not... yet, Captain. But most of them eat together during meals, so I was hoping to speak with them now.
Ah, I see them over there at that table. Well, get to it! The sooner you’re able to impart your knowledge to them, the better.
Of... course.
Are you going to... you know... move?
I was looking for an opening.
An opening?
Well, look at them! They seem to be in the middle of an important conversation!
... Suffice it to say, I haven’t been able to look at a welder’s mask the same way since!
Oh, yes, they really are in the throes of vital discourse, aren’t they?
Go.
All right, all right...
Um...
Mahan? Can we... help you with something?
Well, yes. I was thinking... I mean, the Captain... You know, Admiral Alfred Mahan once said...
*ALARM*
Uh... sorry, Mahan. We have to go.
Right! Give ‘em... uh... hell.

Fields.MenuText: What... what was that?
That was less than inspiring.
Admiral Alfred Mahan once said? Really?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing.
No need to rub it in.
He was an expert strategist! It wasn’t so entirely out of left field!
We’re taking care of the Morganas now. After, we’re having a conversation.
Of course.
@BATTLE
Hold it, Mahan. I’m not letting you run off so quickly.
Drat.
We still need to have that conversation.
I don’t think it’s really necessary, Captain. I mean, I know what you want me to do. I just need to... uh... make it happen.
Yeah, that’s the part I want to talk about.
I’ve seen you talk with the officers before. What’s the problem now?
I’m more than capable of communicating technical information, but you specifically said you wanted me to befriend the officers.
And when it comes to befriending anyone, especially large groups of people like that, well... that sort of thing doesn’t always come easily to me.
I see.
I have no doubt that I could teach them. It’s just that, maybe, a structured classroom setting might better play to my strengths. What do you think?
No?
No. Mahan, my position as captain requires me encourage my crew members in their personal growth. If you need more practice socializing, then socialize you will.
I socialize with you, don’t I? We’re friends. This isn’t really necessary, is it?

Fields.MenuText: We are friends, but I still think it’s in your best interest.
I insist.
You’re right, it’s not. But I have a feeling it will be entertaining, and that’s reason enough for me.

Fields.DialogueText: I wouldn’t bet on it...
... Of course you do.
How am I supposed to respond to that?!
*ALARM*
We’ll start after the battle, Mahan. Remember - the sooner you successfully socialize, the sooner I let you off the hook.
Fine...
@BATTLE
Captain? Morganas are almost in range.
@BATTLE
All right, there are the officers. Now that the battle’s over, you have an opportunity to strike up a conversation.
Kind of curious how they always stand around in groups like that.
Makes your job easier.
Barely.
Honestly, Mahan, I think you’re just overthinking this entire situation. I want you to go over there and act like yourself. Knowledgeable, responsible Mahan.
Oh, good grief.
Just give it a try.
All right, all right.
Hi there, Mahan! Great job during that last battle!
Oh... thanks, Lieutenant. That’s nice of you to say.
I was going to go study... um... some new battle tactics. Anyone want to join me?
Uh, sorry Mahan, but we were about to head over to the mess. You can join us if you like.
Oh, I’m not hungry. Thanks... for offering, though.
What?
They invited you to eat with them! Why didn’t you take them up on their offer?
You said to act like myself! And I wasn’t hungry!

Fields.MenuText: I mean... I guess...
Going with them didn’t mean you had to eat with them!
Oh, this is going to take more work than I thought...

Fields.DialogueText: You don’t have to look quite so deflated.
Oh. Oh, you meant I should have used it as another opportunity to socialize.
You know, you could still change your mind on the whole classroom-setting idea...
We’ll figure this out, Mahan. It might take... a while, but we’ll figure this out.
Fine...
Yes!
Well, there’s no reason to take that tone.
No!
Fine, Captain... Ahab.
What did you call me?
Nothing!
Morganas are almost in range, Captain. I think we've passed the point of no return.
@BATTLE
Mahan?
Don’t ask.
You missed our post battle briefing, you’re soaking wet, and... have you been drinking? The smell of alcohol is quite... strong.
Oh, this isn’t water my clothes are soaked in. It’s beer.
... Ugh. Why?
After my last attempt at socializing with the officers went so poorly, I decided to change course and see if that didn’t improve my prospects.
Since you told me to act like myself last time...
Oh, no.
I decided to act very unlike myself this time.
Oh, no.
The officers were having a somewhat raucous post-battle celebration, and I joined them.
How... wild... did things get?
Oh, the officers were very rambunctious. I, however, found that, no matter how much I will myself to be the life of a party... such a thing will just never come to me naturally.
Well, that’s a relief. But... what about the beer?
Ensign Oster arranged for several kegs to be brought to the wardroom. But by the time they arrived, the officers were too drunk to have the coordination to open them properly.
I was able to stand the kegs upright before beer went everywhere... but not before being soaked in it myself.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, I’m so sorry, Mahan.
Remind me to have a conversation with my officers.
*snicker*

Fields.DialogueText: It’s all right, Captain. I’m somewhat glad I was there - what would the wardroom look like now had I been absent?
Gladly.
Wipe that grin off your face, Captain.
Let’s discuss your next attempt at socializing with the officers... just to avoid any unnecessary issues in the future.
You’ll have no complaints from me.
I have to say, watching the officers clean up after themselves in the wardroom does entertain me, more than it probably ought. Serves them right.
Mmhmm...
Considering what they put you through, I would have thought this quite cathartic for you, Mahan.
Mmhmm...
All right, what is so enthralling in that latest newspaper, Mahan?
Just give me... one second.
I read that newspaper from top to bottom. I know there’s nothing too interesting inside.
*gasp*
Mahan? Are you okay? You look... well, excited. Which isn’t a look I see from you very often. What’s going on?
Did you see this?
See what?
In the paper! This article, down here in the corner?
*ALARM*
Uh... maybe I didn’t read the newspaper quite as thoroughly as I implied...
We’ll discuss it after the battle.
O... kay?
@BATTLE
They're almost in range, Captain. Let's make this a good one!
@BATTLE
So, you want to finally tell me what has you all excited, Mahan?
This, this right here. This says that famed naval strategist Albert Holtman will be giving a lecture in New York City in a matter of days.
Holtman, eh?
Yes! Captain, if you want your crew to learn about strategy, Holtman is the man for the job. He’s made a career of teaching some of the brightest minds in the business.
And, what? Are you expecting me to arrange for the entire the crew to sit in on one of Holtman’s lectures?
No, of course not. But Holtman, he travels all over the world. I say we write to him, and suggest we give him safe passage to his next location...
... provided he give the crew a lecture while on board. The Protection Force would be all for it, I’m sure!
You’re going to write to him?
I am! I know I might not be the most polished conversationalist, but I can pen a mean letter.
Well... if you think it would be beneficial for the crew, I have no problem with you pursuing it.
Oh, thank you, Captain!
But that’s not going to get you out of socializing with the crew.

Fields.MenuText: You know it’s for the best, Mahan.
You didn’t really think that would work, did you, Mahan?
Ha! You should see the downcast look on your face right now.

Fields.DialogueText: I know, I know.
I mean... I had hoped...
Quiet, you.
We’re en route to New York, Mahan. Still working on the letter?
I am, I’m almost done.
Are you going to let me read it before you send it?
Why...?
No reason. I mean, you are a Belle under my command, so it would probably be good for me to have a general awareness of what you’re saying.
You don’t trust me?

Fields.MenuText: I trust you!
It’s not a question of trust. It’s a question of me overseeing what happens on my ship.
I just want to make sure you don’t make the letter sound too gushy. I know you’re a fan of this guy.

Fields.DialogueText: Well... good!
All right, all right.
Gushy? When have I ever come off as gushy?
Here it is. What do you think?
This is... well, I mean...
What?
It is a well thought out letter. You make a solid case as to why Mr. Holtman should come aboard our ship.
But?
The letter is a little dry, that’s all.
Dry?!
Yes, dry. Very business-like. I’m just hoping it catches his attention.
Mr. Holtman is a strategist. Attention to facts and logic should catch his attention above all else.
I guess time will tell.
You don’t have to sound quite so confident, Captain.
*ALARM*
Ready?
Yes, I’m ready.
@BATTLE
Any time someone even mentions the name Alfred Thay...
Okay, point made.
I know impatience can be dangerous... but I really wish they'd just get close enough to shoot already.
Oh, wait. I think they are.
@BATTLE
Now that that battle’s over, it’s only a matter of time until we arrive in New York, Mahan. Still no word from Mr. Holtman?
He’ll answer.
I didn’t say otherwise.
I know he will.
Good!
A little dry, my foot.
I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have said that. You had reason to write the things that you did, and I’m hopeful it will be enough to persuade Mr. Holtman.
Do you...  do you think a more passionate Belle would have had a better chance at success?
I don’t know, I don’t know the man. But let me tell you, as your Captain, I am thrilled to work with a Belle as logical as yourself. I’ve heard horror stories of other Belles...
Heh, there are some wild ones out there. Still...
Still, what?
Well, those other Belles would probably be more popular among the officers aboard their ships, wouldn’t they?
I’m sure every Belle has areas of weakness. The only thing that matters is whether they choose to confront their weaknesses.
I guess that’s right. Thanks, Captain.
Of course, Mahan. Ah, I forgot to tell you - once we make it to the harbor, I’ll be going ashore for a bit. I won’t be gone long.
Bring me whatever newspapers you find, would you?

Fields.MenuText: I would be happy to.
Just, let me read them first this time, would you?
Oh, so demanding...

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain!
I’ll try to restrain myself.
Aren’t you hilarious?
Captain, you were gone a lot longer than I was expec...
AAH!
Calm down, Mahan...
But that’s, that’s... that’s Albert Holtman!
It’s true - that is my name.
But, but... you didn’t answer my letter!
Judging by the state it was in when it arrived, I’d say it was delayed in its coming. I had only just received it when your Captain here tracked me down.
Captain, you... you tracked down Mr. Holtman?
Since we hadn’t heard back from him, I figured the least I could do was drop in and see whether he’d received your letter. You put so much work into it.
He was more than happy to accompany me - he found your letter charming.
You... you did?
I did, Miss Mahan. I must say, I’ve been looking forward to meeting one of you Belles face to face, and the timing was just perfect - I have to go to London for another lecture circuit.
Your captain here told me you would be happy to provide me safe travel.
Of course we would! And you don’t mind... speaking to the crew?
Not at all. It would be my pleasure. Now, if you’ll excuse me for a moment, I’m going to put my things in my quarters.
Oh, certainly! Please, make yourself at home!
Aah!
Okay, let’s bring it down a few notches, shall we?
Aah?
Better.
@BATTLE
Mr. Holtman, Mahan. You two look quite pleased to be spending time with one another.
I must say, Captain - as compelling as Miss Mahan’s letter was, I am endlessly impressed by her knowledge of naval strategy.
Do you hear that, Captain? Mr. Holtman finds me impressive.

Fields.MenuText: Well, he’s right - your knowledge of naval strategy is impressive.
And you couldn’t be happier about that, could you?
Try not to get too big a head, Mahan.

Fields.DialogueText: Aw, thank you, Captain.
Not really, no!
As long as my head can still fit through the doorway, I think I’ll be all right.
What have the two of you been discussing?
Ah, what subjects to cover during my lecture aboard this ship.
It’s important to use discernment - we want the ideas to be accessible to those less knowledgeable, yet thought provoking to those with a deeper understanding of the subject.
That’s no small task.
Indeed, but I do believe that Miss Mahan and I have decided on a curriculum, one which will be especially practical to the officers and crew aboard your ship.
I’m thrilled to hear it. When do you start?
*ALARM*
How about we set a time after this battle?
A marvelous idea, Miss Mahan.
@BATTLE
Well, Mr. Holtman has scheduled his lecture. Which means, all that’s left to do is to invite the crew.
I can make some fliers, hang them around the ship. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: Actually, I had a different idea in mind.
No.
You don’t want to know.

Fields.DialogueText: What idea is that?
No? But... what are we going to do instead?
... I don’t like that grin on your face, Captain.
Go invite them yourself, Mahan.
What?! Oh, please don’t make me do that, Captain.
It’s just an invitation! You don’t even have to make extended conversation with them!
How excited do you think they’ll be for the lecture if I’m the one inviting them? How embarrassing would it be if no one showed up?
Use that as incentive. You don’t want to disappoint Mr. Holtman, do you?
No...
*ALARM*
Well, then, you best get to it. And stop glowering.
I’ll glower as long as I want...
@BATTLE
Let’s just say they’re not going to name a building after me at Trinity College anytime soon.
Hey there, officers!
Mahan? You seem... excited?
Why does everyone think it’s strange to see me excited?
I don’t know, I guess you just seem pretty stoic most of the time.
That doesn’t mean... You know, whatever. Listen, have you seen our new guest on board?
The magician?
Ooo, I did see that magician. I mean, I saw him for a moment, and then, I don’t know, it was like, he was just gone.
No, not the... magician. We really have a magician on board? Nevermind, don’t answer that. No. Albert Holtman, the world renowned naval strategist?
Don’t all answer at once. We have a strategist on board, and he’s graciously offered to give a lecture - free of charge - to the officers and crew.
What do you think? You want to come?
Uh...
Uh...
Heh.
I mean, if we have time?
Sure?
*ALARM*
Great.

Fields.MenuText: I mean, I think it was somewhat of an improvement.
Remember, this is for the good of the crew. Don’t let up.
We have a magician on board? Where?

Fields.DialogueText: Not a high bar to pass, Captain.
I know...
@BATTLE
Captain, I’ve been at this for an embarrassingly long amount of time. Officers have started leaving when I enter the room.
Please, can’t you just order them to come?
There’s still time yet, Mahan.
When will you admit that it’s a lost cause?
Okay, listen to me, Mahan. This is a long war we have ahead of us. Rallying crew members is something I need you capable of doing on your own, without my backing.
But...
But, nothing. Now, you’re a strategist. Figure something out.
Huh?
How do you develop a strategy for battle?
I... well, I consider the enemy’s battle plan, and develop some means of answering their tactics with my own.
All right. Do that here. Surely a protege of the great Alfred Thayer Mahan can figure something out.
It’s really not nice to use my namesake against me.
*ALARM*
You can do this.
@BATTLE
I can do this.
I can do this.
Officer McNamara?
Mahan? Here, you want an orange? I grabbed two from the wardroom, but I’m really only hungry for one.
Uh... sure.
What’s up?
Why are you so sure something’s... up?
Because you’re the sort who only strikes up a conversation with someone when business is on the table.
Not only.
But most of the time.
Well... okay, that’s fair.
So, what is it?
Well, you’re clearly the most popular officer aboard the ship.
That’s kind of you to say.
Well, it’s true. Your stories are already the stuff of legend.
I make half the stuff up.
You do?
Yeah, I just like entertaining people.
See - and that’s exactly why people like you as much as they do.
And... what? You want to leverage my popularity to get people to come to Mr. what’s-his-name’s lectures?
Hit the nail on the head, didn’t I?
I mean, I wish I could say no. Does that make me a terrible person?
Eh, not entirely. And sure.
Sure... what?
Sure, I’ll help you convince people to come.
Really?
Yeah, well, I figure the officers still owe you after the whole beer incident in the wardroom.
Ah, yes. I’d agree with that.
*ALARM*
Start after the battle?
Uh... yes! Sure!
Sounds good.
@BATTLE
So, how are we going to do this, McNamara? What’s your game plan?
Are you containing a laugh?
Sorry, sorry. I’ll stop.
What’s so funny?
There’s no game plan to this. I mean, clearly, your game plan was to get me to help you. And you were successful. But now, no game plan.
No game plan?
No game plan. Just follow me.
Officer Nee! Boys! How’s it going?
NcNamara! Where have you been? We’ve been waiting for you!
Oh, I’ve been talking to Mahan, here. She was telling me about that guy - Holtzerman...
Holtman.
... Whatever, that guy’s lecture. And you know what? I think I’m going to go.
You’re going to go? Why?
I don’t know. I mean, the idea of improving myself so that I maybe have a chance of making it back home to Dublin does seem somewhat attractive.
... You have a point there.
Who’s with me?
*murmured consent*
Mahan?
Ack!
What’s... wrong with you?
Nothing! Just... don’t say anything.
About?
Anything!
Coming, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: What was going on over there?
Why do you look so guilty?
Did the sound “ack” just come out of your mouth?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing much!
Guilty? I’m not guilty! At all.
... No? I... was just saying hello to... Jack. You know, Officer... Jack.
Just trying to convince those officers to come to the lecture, as always.
*ALARM*
All right... keep up the good work.
*phew*
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Ready, Captain?
@BATTLE
Great battle, Mahan. Keep up the good work!
You’ve got it, Captain!
Okay, Mahan, you want to tell me just what that was earlier?
I don’t know what you’re talking about.
You’re a terrible liar, you know that?
Yeah, I do. Uh, see, the Captain tasked me with befriending you all, imparting strategic advice when possible and inviting you to Holtman’s lecture.
Really?
The Captain’s kind of under the impression that my socialization skills could use some work.
I mean...
... Yeah, it’s fair. So, anyway, I don’t know how thrilled the Captain would be to find out that I convinced you to help me invite the officers, instead of just inviting them myself.
Ah, I see.
So, just... could you try not to make it blatantly obvious to the Captain that you’re helping me?
Eh, shouldn’t be that difficult.
Really?
I have no idea, really. But I’ll give it my best shot.
You know, I think you’re the nicest officer aboard this ship.
How many officers have you spent more than ten minutes talking to?
You really should get to know more of the officers.
Yes, I know!
Okay, guys. Just make sure you’re not late. The lecture’s going to be great, I promise.
All right, all right, you’ve convinced us, McNamara.
Officer McNamara?
Cap... tain.
Could have a word with you?
... Sure?
Come with me.
Everything all right, Captain?
I’m just curious, what were you doing back there?
Back there?
Yes, back there.
On deck?
Yes, on deck.
Uh, I was telling the other officers that they should come to that Holtman guy’s lecture.
Mahan has really gotten a lot of people excited for it - myself included - and I was just spreading the word.
Were you, now?
Yes.
Mahan talked to you, and convinced you to go the lecture?
Yes?
... All right, then.
That’s... all?
Yes, Lieutenant, that’s all. I mean, I know she convinced you to help her with the recruiting...
Real... ly.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, really.
I’m the captain of this ship, McNamara. Knowing what goes on on board is literally part of my job description.
Well, Mahan’s a terrible liar, and you’re awful at covering your tracks, so it wasn’t that difficult to figure out.

Fields.DialogueText: Okay, then.
That... makes sense.
All of that... those are true things you just said, Captain.
Just... she’s really been trying. And I was honestly happy to help her.
*ALARM*
Thank you, McNamara. Now, get to your station.
Yes, Captain.
@BATTLE
Ready for the day's exercise, Captain?
@BATTLE
Good battle, Mahan. ... Mahan?
Captain...
You’re grimacing.
Yeah, well...
McNamara told you about our little conversation.
Yes, he did.
You can stop grimacing, Mahan.
Can I though? You know me - I’m a by the rules sort of Belle, who really doesn’t like getting in trouble if at all possible.
You’re not in trouble.
I’m... not?
Tell me, what was your thought process in approaching McNamara, in asking for his help?
Well, uh... you had said to think strategically. And McNamara, he’s the most popular person on this ship.
So, I figured that, if anyone was going to be able to convince other people to come, he would. And fortunately, he turned out to be about the most agreeable person on this ship.
So he’s been helping me. I mean, I haven’t just been sitting on my heels while he’s been out there inviting people - I’ve continued trying my best.
But, well, he’s definitely better at this than I am.
Mmhmm.
You’re not... upset?
Did you take my advice?
Yes...
Did you devise a strategic method to invite the officers?
Yes...
Did you socialize?
I mean, with McNamara, I guess?
Good. You did well.
You’re serious?
I’m serious.
Ha! Well, uh, then... I guess I’ll get back to it!
Good thinking.
Was it just me, or did the lecture go...
... Really well?
Like, really well.
I mean, I understand now why Holtman is in such high demand.
He doesn’t just understand strategy, he’s capable of communicating it to other people with ease.
He really is.
Maybe that’s something you can work on improving, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: You’re probably right.
Watch it, now.
Oh, you’re pretty proud of that burn, aren’t you?

Fields.DialogueText: It’s pretty difficult to ruffle your feathers, you know that?
My apologies, Captain.
I am, yes.
That was a terrific lecture, Mahan.
I mean, I can’t believe the words are coming out of my mouth, but I did enjoy myself.
Thanks, Officer Nee, Officer Oster. I’m so happy you found the lecture beneficial.
You think you owe McNamara a small debt of gratitude?
Oh, I know I do. I’ve already arranged for a giant shipment of oranges to be delivered to his quarters.
Oranges?
Yeah, they’re his favorite.
*ALARM*
Time to go.
Let’s put some of this new strategic knowledge to good use.
@BATTLE
We can’t thank you enough for the lecture you gave, Mr. Holtman. It was even better than I expected.
I have no doubt the crew will make good use of your instruction.
Well, it was my pleasure. It was a treat speaking to a deployed crew, especially those in such a noble fight.
Mahan, stay in touch, would you? If you develop any groundbreaking new strategies, you will let me know, won’t you?
Of... of course!
I’m happy to hear it. I wish you both luck.
Look at that. You, continuing to make a good impression.
I... know! And with Albert Holtman, of all people. I can’t believe it.
It was a good thing you did for the crew, Mahan. I know it wasn’t an easy road getting Mr. Holtman here and getting the officers and crew into his lecture...
... but you stuck with it, and saw it through. Thank you for all of your hard work.
Aw... thanks, Captain. And I have to say, even though I’m still not a tremendous fan of socialization... I’m glad you pushed me to do so.
Of course, Mahan.
*ALARM*
Shall we?
Of course.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
All hands to battlestations!
@BATTLE
Mahan!
Well, hello there, Captain! Where did you disappear to after that battle?
I was expecting a delivery. I’ll have you know, I arranged for a new shipment of newspapers to come in. They’re waiting in my office.
I thought we could start reading through them together.
Oh, thank you so much, Captain! Although...
What is it?
Well, Officer McNamara was going to teach me the art of the anecdote. I was just headed over to meet him right now. You don’t mind if I...
No, no, that’s fine, Mahan. The newspapers will keep.
Excellent. I can’t wait to read them. See you... in a little while?
Of course.
Great.

Fields.MenuText: It really is great that she’s found another friend.
